It also returns the address of the decryption oracle.\n */\nlibrary ZamaConfig {\n    function getSepoliaProtocolId() internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        /// @note Zama Ethereum Sepolia protocol id is '10000 + Zama Ethereum protocol id'\n        return 10001;\n    }\n\n    function getSepoliaConfig() internal pure returns (CoprocessorConfig memory) {\n        return\n            CoprocessorConfig({\n                ACLAddress: 0x50157CFfD6bBFA2DECe204a89ec419c23ef5755D,\n                CoprocessorAddress: 0xCD3ab3bd6bcc0c0bf3E27912a92043e817B1cf69,\n                DecryptionOracleAddress: SepoliaZamaOracleAddress,\n                KMSVerifierAddress: 0x1364cBBf2cDF5032C47d8226a6f6FBD2AFCDacAC\n            });\n    }\n\n    function getEthereumProtocolId() internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        /// @note Zama Ethereum protocol id is '1'\n        return 1;\n    }\n\n    function getEthereumConfig() internal pure returns (CoprocessorConfig memory) {\n        /// @note The addresses below are placeholders and should be replaced with actual addresses\n        /// once deployed on the Ethereum mainnet.\n        return\n            CoprocessorConfig({\n                ACLAddress: address(0),\n                CoprocessorAddress: address(0),\n                DecryptionOracleAddress: address(0),\n                KMSVerifierAddress: address(0)\n            });\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * @title   SepoliaConfig.\n * @dev     This contract can be inherited by a contract wishing to use the FHEVM contracts provided by Zama\n *          on the Sepolia network (chainId = 11155111).\n *          Other providers may offer similar contracts deployed at different addresses.\n *          If you wish to use them, you should rely on the instructions from these providers.\n */\ncontract SepoliaConfig {\n    constructor() {\n        FHE.setCoprocessor(ZamaConfig.getSepoliaConfig());\n    }\n\n    function protocolId() public pure returns (uint256) {\n        return ZamaConfig.getSepoliaProtocolId();\n    }\n}\n\n/**\n * @title   EthereumConfig.\n * @dev     This contract can be inherited by a contract wishing to use the FHEVM contracts provided by Zama\n *          on the Ethereum (mainnet) network (chainId = 1).\n *          Other providers may offer similar contracts deployed at different addresses.\n *          If you wish to use them, you should rely on the instructions from these providers.\n */\ncontract EthereumConfig {\n    constructor() {\n        FHE.setCoprocessor(ZamaConfig.getEthereumConfig());\n    }\n\n    function protocolId() public pure returns (uint256) {\n        return ZamaConfig.getEthereumProtocolId();\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xd7f4d44082b8281f31769e961b468786cacce9a318df56aa9a0dd7d4fb47e2e7","license":"BSD-3-Clause-Clear"},"@fhevm/solidity/lib/FHE.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: required from DecryptionOracle.\n */\ninterface IDecryptionOracle {\n    function requestDecryption(\n        uint256 requestID,\n        bytes32[] calldata ctsHandles,\n        bytes4 the decryptionProof\n     * - 32 bytes: length of the cleartexts (total number of bytes)\n     * - n*32 bytes: the \"n\" cleartext values, with \"n\" the number of handles\n     * - 32 bytes: length of the decryptionProof (total number of bytes)\n     * - ... the data of the decryptionProof (signatures, extra data)\n     */\n    function verifySignatures(\n        bytes32[] memory handlesList,\n        bytes memory cleartexts,\n        bytes memory decryptionProof\n    ) private returns (bool) {\n        // Compute the signature offset\n        // This offset is computed by considering the format encoded by the KMS when creating the\n        // \"decryptedResult\" bytes array (see comment below), which is the following:\n        // - requestID: 32 bytes\n        // - all \"n\" decrypted values (which is \"cleartexts\" itself): n*32 bytes (\"cleartexts.length\" bytes)\n        // - offset of the signatures: 32 bytes\n        // - the rest of signature values (lengths, offsets, values)\n        // This means the expected offset to concatenate to the \"decryptedResult\" bytes array has\n        // the following value: 32 + n*32 + 32\n        // See https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/abi-spec.html#use-of-dynamic-types for more details.\n        // The signature offset will most likely be removed in the future,\n        // see https://github.com/zama-ai/fhevm-internal/issues/345\n        uint256 signaturesOffset = 32 + cleartexts.length + 32;\n\n        // Built the \"decryptedResult\" bytes array\n        // Currently, the \"decryptedResult\" is encoded (by the KMS) in the following format:\n        // - n*32 bytes: the \"n\" decrypted values, \"cleartexts\" itself\n        // - 32 bytes: offset of the signatures, as explained above\n        // This is equivalent to concatenating the cleartexts and the signatures offset, which can\n        // be done using abi.encoded in a gas efficient way.\n        // The signature offset will most likely be removed in the future,\n        // see https://github.com/zama-ai/fhevm-internal/issues/345\n        // Here we can use \"encodePacked\" instead of \"abi.encode\" to save gas, as the cleartexts\n        // and the signaturesOffset are already 32 bytes aligned (ie, no padding needed).\n        bytes memory decryptedResult = abi.encodePacked(cleartexts, signaturesOffset);\n\n        CoprocessorConfig storage $ = Impl.getCoprocessorConfig();\n        return\n            IKMSVerifier($.KMSVerifierAddress).verifyDecryptionEIP712KMSSignatures(\n                handlesList,\n                decryptedResult,\n                decryptionProof\n            );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(ebool value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = ebool.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(euint8 value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = euint8.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(euint16 value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = euint16.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(euint32 value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = euint32.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(euint64 value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = euint64.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(euint128 value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = euint128.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. Used when requesting a decryption.\n     */\n    function toBytes32(eaddress value) internal pure returns (bytes32 ct) {\n        ct = eaddress.unwrap(value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Converts handle from its custom type to the underlying bytes32. are needed in a typical dApp.\n */\nstruct CoprocessorConfig {\n    address ACLAddress;\n    address CoprocessorAddress;\n    address DecryptionOracleAddress;\n    address KMSVerifierAddress;\n}\n\n/**\n * @title   DecryptionRequests\n * @notice  This struct contains the internal counter for requestIDs generated by the dapp,\n *          and the mapping from internal requestIDs to list of handles requested for decryption.\n */\nstruct DecryptionRequests {\n    uint256 counterRequest;\n    mapping(uint256 => bytes32[]) requestedHandles;\n}\n\n/**\n * @title   IFHEVMExecutor\n * @notice  This interface contains all functions to conduct FHE operations.\n */\ninterface IFHEVMExecutor {\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheAdd operation.\n     * bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheSub operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheSub(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheMul operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheMul(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheDiv operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheDiv(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheRem operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheRem(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheBitAnd operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheBitAnd(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheBitOr operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheBitOr(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheBitXor operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n fheShl(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheShr operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheShr(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheRotl operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs           RHS.\n     * @param scalarByte    Scalar byte.\n     * @return result       Result.\n     */\n    function fheRotr(bytes32 lhs, bytes32 rhs, bytes1 scalarByte) external returns (bytes32 result);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice              Computes fheEq operation.\n     * @param lhs           LHS.\n     * @param rhs SPDX-License-Identifier: BSD-3-Clause-Clear\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.24;\n\naddress constant SepoliaZamaOracleAddress = 0xa02Cda4Ca3a71D7C46997716F4283aa851C28812;\n","keccak256":"0x1e1117254b0e777ecbb902f3b9bb7d0b10920b7896e5eaa62b5163046685b28b","license":"BSD-3-Clause-Clear"},"contracts/LifeProof.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.24;\n\nimport {ERC721} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721.sol\";\nimport {Ownable} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol\";\n\n// FHEVM\nimport {FHE, euint8, euint32, euint64, euint256, ebool, externalEuint8} from \"@fhevm/solidity/lib/FHE.sol\";\nimport {SepoliaConfig} from \"@fhevm/solidity/config/ZamaConfig.sol\";\n\n/**\n * LifeProof \u2013 \u751f\u6d3b\u4e8b\u4ef6\u4e0a\u94fe\u6863\u6848 NFT\n *\n * \u8bbe\u8ba1\u8981\u70b9\uff1a\n * - \u6587\u672c\u4e0e\u5143\u6570\u636e URI \u6309\u9700\u6c42\u4e0a\u94fe\uff08title\u3001description\u3001imageURI\u3001category\u3001timestamp\u3001isPublic\uff09\u3002\n * - \u201c\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570 moodScore(0-100)\u201d \u4f5c\u4e3a\u9690\u79c1\u5b57\u6bb5\uff0c\u4f7f\u7528 FHE euint8 \u5b58\u50a8\u548c\u8fd0\u7b97\u3002\n * - \u5141\u8bb8\u7528\u6237\u57fa\u4e8e ACL \u89e3\u5bc6\u81ea\u5df1\u7684\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570\uff1b\u5e76\u63d0\u4f9b\u516c\u5171\u52a0\u5bc6\u53e5\u67c4\u8bfb\u53d6\u63a5\u53e3\u3002\n */\ncontract LifeProof is ERC721, Ownable, SepoliaConfig {\n    struct LifeEvent {\n        string title;\n        string description;\n        string imageURI;     // IPFS CID\n        string category;     // Graduation / Marriage / Travel / ...\n        uint256 timestamp;   // unix seconds\n        bool isPublic;       // public or private\n    }\n\n    uint256 public nextTokenId;\n\n    // tokenId => LifeEvent\n    mapping(uint256 => LifeEvent) public lifeEvents;\n\n    // tokenId => encrypted mood score (0..100)\n    mapping(uint256 => euint8) private _moodScore;\n\n    // tokenId => owner\n    mapping(uint256 => address) private _ownerOfToken;\n\n    // --- Public feed / likes / comments ---\n    uint256[] private _publicFeed; // append-only; read-time\u8fc7\u6ee4 isPublic\n    mapping(uint256 => bool) private _everPublished; // \u9632\u6b62\u91cd\u590d\u52a0\u5165 feed\n\n    mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => bool)) private _liked;\n    mapping(uint256 => uint256) public likeCounts;\n\n    struct CommentInfo {\n        address user;\n        string cid; // IPFS CID or short text\n        uint256 timestamp;\n    }\n    mapping(uint256 => CommentInfo[]) private _comments;\n\n    event LifeEventCreated(address indexed user, uint256 indexed tokenId);\n    event LifeEventVisibilityChanged(uint256 indexed tokenId, bool isPublic);\n    event LifeEventPublished(uint256 indexed tokenId);\n    event LifeEventLiked(uint256 indexed tokenId, address indexed user, bool liked, uint256 newCount);\n    event LifeEventCommented(uint256 indexed tokenId, address indexed user, string cid);\n\n    constructor() ERC721(\"LifeProof\", \"LIFE\") Ownable(msg.sender) {}\n\n    /**\n     * \u94f8\u9020\u4e00\u6761\u751f\u6d3b\u4e8b\u4ef6\uff0c\u5e76\u5b58\u50a8\u52a0\u5bc6\u7684\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570\u3002\n     * - moodExternal: \u5916\u90e8\u52a0\u5bc6\u8f93\u5165 (externalEuint8)\n     * - proof: Relayer \u751f\u6210\u7684\u8f93\u5165\u8bc1\u660e\n     *\n     * \u8bf4\u660e\uff1a\n     * - \u5185\u90e8\u901a\u8fc7 FHE.fromExternal \u8f6c\u4e3a euint8\u3002\n     * - \u8bbe\u7f6e ACL\uff1a\u5408\u7ea6\u81ea\u8eab\u4e0e\u8c03\u7528\u8005\u53ef\u8bbf\u95ee\uff08\u4fbf\u4e8e\u540e\u7eed\u6388\u6743\u4e0e\u7528\u6237\u89e3\u5bc6\uff09\u3002\n     */\n    function mintLifeEvent(\n        string memory title,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory imageURI,\n        string memory category,\n        bool isPublic,\n        externalEuint8 moodExternal,\n        bytes calldata proof\n    ) external returns (uint256 tokenId) {\n        tokenId = ++nextTokenId;\n\n        // 1) mint NFT\n        _safeMint(msg.sender, tokenId);\n        _ownerOfToken[tokenId] = msg.sender;\n\n        // 2) store public metadata\n        lifeEvents[tokenId] = LifeEvent({\n            title: title,\n            description: description,\n            imageURI: imageURI,\n            category: category,\n            timestamp: block.timestamp,\n            isPublic: isPublic\n        });\n\n        // 3) convert external encrypted mood into internal FHE type\n        euint8 mood = FHE.fromExternal(moodExternal, proof);\n\n        // 4) clamp to 0..100 using FHE ops (\u9632\u5fa1\u6027\u5904\u7406)\n        euint8 maxAllowed = FHE.asEuint8(100);\n        euint8 zero = FHE.asEuint8(0);\n        // min(mood, 100)\n        euint8 bounded = FHE.min(mood, maxAllowed);\n        // max(bounded, 0) \u7531\u4e8e\u65e0\u7b26\u53f7\uff0c\u6b64\u6b65\u4ec5\u793a\u4f8b\n        _moodScore[tokenId] = FHE.max(bounded, zero);\n\n        // 5) set ACL for future decryptions\n        FHE.allowThis(_moodScore[tokenId]);\n        FHE.allow(_moodScore[tokenId], msg.sender);\n\n        // \u82e5\u4e8b\u4ef6\u4e3a\u516c\u5f00\uff0c\u5219\u5728\u94f8\u9020\u65f6\u76f4\u63a5\u53d1\u5e03\u5230\u516c\u5171\u5e7f\u573a\uff08\u907f\u514d\u524d\u7aef\u989d\u5916\u518d\u8c03\u7528\u4e00\u6b21\u53ef\u89c1\u6027\u5207\u6362\uff09\n        if (isPublic && !_everPublished[tokenId]) {\n            _everPublished[tokenId] = true;\n            _publicFeed.push(tokenId);\n            emit LifeEventPublished(tokenId);\n        }\n\n        emit LifeEventCreated(msg.sender, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function toggleVisibility(uint256 tokenId, bool isPublic) external {\n        _requireOwnedBySender(tokenId);\n        lifeEvents[tokenId].isPublic = isPublic;\n        emit LifeEventVisibilityChanged(tokenId, isPublic);\n        if (isPublic && !_everPublished[tokenId]) {\n            _everPublished[tokenId] = true;\n            _publicFeed.push(tokenId);\n            emit LifeEventPublished(tokenId);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * \u8fd4\u56de\u8c03\u7528\u8005\u7684\u6240\u6709 LifeEvent\n     * \u6ce8\u610f\uff1a\u4ec5\u8fd4\u56de\u5143\u6570\u636e\uff1b\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570\u4e3a\u52a0\u5bc6\u5b58\u50a8\uff0c\u5355\u72ec\u63a5\u53e3\u63d0\u4f9b\u53e5\u67c4\u3002\n     */\n    function getMyEvents() external view returns (LifeEvent[] memory) {\n        uint256 balance = balanceOf(msg.sender);\n        LifeEvent[] memory result = new LifeEvent[](balance);\n\n        uint256 found;\n        uint256 supply = nextTokenId;\n        for (uint256 tokenId = 1; tokenId <= supply; tokenId++) {\n            if (_ownerOfToken[tokenId] == msg.sender) {\n                result[found++] = lifeEvents[tokenId];\n                if (found == balance) break;\n            }\n        }\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * \u8fd4\u56de\u8c03\u7528\u8005\u6240\u62e5\u6709\u7684 tokenId \u5217\u8868\uff08\u4e0e getMyEvents \u8fd4\u56de\u987a\u5e8f\u4e00\u81f4\uff09\u3002\n     */\n    function getMyEventIds() external view returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        uint256 balance = balanceOf(msg.sender);\n        uint256[] memory ids = new uint256[](balance);\n        uint256 found;\n        uint256 supply = nextTokenId;\n        for (uint256 tokenId = 1; tokenId <= supply; tokenId++) {\n            if (_ownerOfToken[tokenId] == msg.sender) {\n                ids[found++] = tokenId;\n                if (found == balance) break;\n            }\n        }\n        return ids;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * \u8bfb\u53d6\u6307\u5b9a token \u7684\u52a0\u5bc6\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570\u53e5\u67c4\uff08\u7528\u4e8e\u524d\u7aef\u89e3\u5bc6\uff09\u3002\n     * - \u53ea\u6709 NFT \u62e5\u6709\u8005\u53ef\u8bfb\u53d6\uff08\u9690\u79c1\u5b57\u6bb5\uff09\u3002\n     */\n    function getMoodHandle(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (euint8) {\n        _requireOwnedBySender(tokenId);\n        return _moodScore[tokenId];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * \u4e3a\u6307\u5b9a token \u7684\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570\u6388\u4e88\u4e34\u65f6\u8bbf\u95ee\u6743\u9650\uff08\u5f53\u524d\u4ea4\u6613\uff09\u3002\n     * \u53ef\u7528\u4e8e\u67d0\u4e9b\u94fe\u4e0a\u8ba1\u7b97\u540e\u518d\u89e3\u5bc6\u7684\u573a\u666f\u3002\n     */\n    function allowTransientMood(uint256 tokenId, address user) external {\n        _requireOwnedBySender(tokenId);\n        FHE.allowTransient(_moodScore[tokenId], user);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * \u793a\u4f8b\uff1a\u5bf9\u5fc3\u60c5\u5206\u6570\u505a\u52a0\u6cd5\uff08\u52a0 k\uff0ck \u4e3a\u660e\u6587\u5c0f\u6574\u6570\uff09\uff0c\u5e76\u8fd4\u56de\u65b0\u7684\u52a0\u5bc6\u5206\u6570\u3002\n     * - \u4f7f\u7528\u6807\u91cf\u8fd0\u7b97\u4ee5\u8282\u7701 gas\u3002\n     */\n    function addToMood(uint256 tokenId, uint8 k) external {\n        _requireOwnedBySender(tokenId);\n        euint8 v = _moodScore[tokenId];\n        v = FHE.add(v, k);\n        // \u518d\u505a\u8fb9\u754c\u88c1\u526a\n        v = FHE.min(v, FHE.asEuint8(100));\n        _moodScore[tokenId] = v;\n        // \u66f4\u65b0 ACL\uff08\u4fdd\u8bc1\u540e\u7eed\u4ecd\u53ef\u89e3\u5bc6\uff09\n        FHE.allowThis(_moodScore[tokenId]);\n        FHE.allow(_moodScore[tokenId], msg.sender);\n    }\n\n    function _requireOwnedBySender(uint256 tokenId) internal view {\n        require(_ownerOfToken[tokenId] == msg.sender, \"Not token owner\");\n    }\n\n    // ----------------------\n    // Public Feed / Likes / Comments\n    // ----------------------\n\n    function getEvent(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (LifeEvent memory) {\n        return lifeEvents[tokenId];\n    }\n\n    function getPublicFeed(uint256 offset, uint256 limit) external view returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        uint256 n = _publicFeed.length;\n        if (offset >= n) return new uint256[](0);\n        uint256 remaining = n - offset;\n        uint256 size = remaining < limit ? remaining : limit;\n        uint256[] memory out = new uint256[](size);\n        // \u6700\u65b0\u4f18\u5148\uff1a\u4ece\u5c3e\u90e8\u5f80\u524d\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n            uint256 idx = n - 1 - (offset + i);\n            uint256 tokenId = _publicFeed[idx];\n            if (lifeEvents[tokenId].isPublic) {\n                out[i] = tokenId;\n            } else {\n                out[i] = 0; // \u7531\u524d\u7aef\u8fc7\u6ee4 0\n            }\n        }\n        return out;\n    }\n\n    function like(uint256 tokenId, bool doLike) external {\n        require(tokenId > 0 && tokenId <= nextTokenId, \"Invalid tokenId\");\n        require(lifeEvents[tokenId].isPublic, \"Not public\");\n        bool cur = _liked[tokenId][msg.sender];\n        if (doLike && !cur) {\n            _liked[tokenId][msg.sender] = true;\n            likeCounts[tokenId] += 1;\n            emit LifeEventLiked(tokenId, msg.sender, true, likeCounts[tokenId]);\n        } else if (!doLike && cur) {\n            _liked[tokenId][msg.sender] = false;\n            if (likeCounts[tokenId] > 0) likeCounts[tokenId] -= 1;\n            emit LifeEventLiked(tokenId, msg.sender, false, likeCounts[tokenId]);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function hasLiked(uint256 tokenId, address user) external view returns (bool) {\n        return _liked[tokenId][user];\n    }\n\n    function addComment(uint256 tokenId, string calldata cid) external {\n        require(tokenId > 0 && tokenId <= nextTokenId, \"Invalid tokenId\");\n        require(lifeEvents[tokenId].isPublic, \"Not public\");\n        _comments[tokenId].push(CommentInfo({user: msg.sender, cid: cid, timestamp: block.timestamp}));\n        emit LifeEventCommented(tokenId, msg.sender, cid);\n    }\n\n    function getComments(uint256 tokenId, uint256 offset, uint256 limit) external view returns (CommentInfo[] memory) {\n        CommentInfo[] storage all = _comments[tokenId];\n        uint256 n = all.length;\n        if (offset >= n) return new CommentInfo[](0);\n        uint256 remaining = n - offset;\n        uint256 size = remaining < limit ? remaining : limit;\n        CommentInfo[] memory out = new CommentInfo[](size);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n            out[i] = all[n - 1 - (offset + i)]; // \u6700\u65b0\u4f18\u5148\n        }\n        return out;\n ERC721IncorrectOwner(address,uint256,add.details: Indicates an error related to the ownership over a particular token. Used in transfers.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InsufficientApproval(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `operator`’s approval. Used in transfers.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC721InvalidOperator(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `operator` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidOwner(address).details: Indicates that an address can't be an owner. For example, `address(0)` is a forbidden owner in ERC-20. Used in balance queries.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.

ERC721InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721NonexistentToken(uint256).details: Indicates a `tokenId` whose `owner` is the zero address.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

approve(address,uint256).details: Gives permission to `to` to transfer `tokenId` token to another account. The approval is cleared when the token is transferred. Only a single account can be approved at a time, so approving the zero address clears previous approvals. Requirements: - The caller must own the token or be an approved operator. - `tokenId` must exist. Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the number of tokens in ``owner``'s account.

getApproved(uint256).details: Returns the account approved for `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Returns if the `operator` is allowed to manage all of the assets of `owner`. See {setApprovalForAll}

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

ownerOf(uint256).details: Returns the owner of the `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`, checking first that contract recipients are aware of the ERC-721 protocol to prevent tokens from being forever locked. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been allowed to move this token by either {approve} or   {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Approve or remove `operator` as an operator for the caller. Operators can call {transferFrom} or {safeTransferFrom} for any token owned by the caller. Requirements: - The `operator` cannot be the address zero. Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for `tokenId` token.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. WARNING: Note that the caller is responsible to confirm that the recipient is capable of receiving ERC-721 or else they may be permanently lost. Usage of {safeTransferFrom} prevents loss, though the caller must understand this adds an external call which potentially creates a reentrancy vulnerability. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addToMood(uint256,uint8).notice: 示例：对心情分数做加法（加 k，k 为明文小整数），并返回新的加密分数。 - 使用标量运算以节省 gas。

allowTransientMood(uint256,address).notice: 为指定 token 的心情分数授予临时访问权限（当前交易）。 可用于某些链上计算后再解密的场景。

getMoodHandle(uint256).notice: 读取指定 token 的加密心情分数句柄（用于前端解密）。 - 只有 NFT 拥有者可读取（隐私字段）。

getMyEventIds().notice: 返回调用者所拥有的 tokenId 列表（与 getMyEvents 返回顺序一致）。

getMyEvents().notice: 返回调用者的所有 LifeEvent 注意：仅返回元数据；心情分数为加密存储，单独接口提供句柄。

mintLifeEvent(string,string,string,strin.notice: 铸造一条生活事件，并存储加密的心情分数。 - moodExternal: 外部加密输入 (externalEuint8) - proof: Relayer 生成的输入证明 说明： - 内部通过 FHE.fromExternal 转为 euint8。 - 设置 ACL：合约自身与调用者可访问（便于后续授权与用户解密）。

userdoc.notice: LifeProof – 生活事件上链档案 NFT 设计要点： - 文本与元数据 URI 按需求上链（title、description、imageURI、category、timestamp、isPublic）。 - “心情分数 moodScore(0-100)” 作为隐私字段，使用 FHE euint8 存储和运算。 - 允许用户基于 ACL 解密自己的心情分数；并提供公共加密句柄读取接口。
